watcher.var: set what to do when i have a number
what to do when i have a number

block-definition.comment: Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'respond as heard' as words are recognised $nl %'handle final response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message $nl with language %'language' $nl with %'max alternatives' maximum number of alternatives $nl %'handle alternatives' with the list of alternative recognitions $nl %'handle confidences' with the list of confidences
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be its code or name. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

block-definition.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %'report'
block-definition.comment: When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'. Optionally reports errors. The 'stop speech recognition' block will stop the listening as will silence that triggers a 'no-speech' error.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.s: Train with audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap!

Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: As it recognises what is spoken it passes the list of label confidences to the 'process confidences' input. If model is "Pre-trained model of 20 words" then it will recognise 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'go', 'stop', 'yes', and 'no', Alternatively if model is "User-trained model" then the model trained by running the "Train with audio buckets" block will be used. Use the 'stop listening for audio label confidences' block to stop this.

inputs.input: User-trained modelPre-trained model of 20 words User-trained model

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block where the saved training has been copied to a web server.

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from file then %'after loading training data'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block . It prompts for the file.

block-definition.s: load JavaScript %'URL' $nl and then %'do after loading' $nl or if there is an error %'do if error'

block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: Get predictions using Teachable Machine audio model %'URL' $nl and process each word recognised %'process word predictions' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'

custom-block.s: load JavaScript %txt %br and then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Stop listening for audio label confidences
block-definition.comment: If any of the blocks listening for speech or sounds are running this stops them.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice' (number or name). 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.
Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

block-definition.s: Create costume in style %'Which style' from %'costume' $nl then %'receive new costume'
block-definition.comment: Applies the selected style to the indicated custome number and adds the new costume this sprite.

input.options: Katsushika Hokusai's Wave Francis Picabia's Udnie Pablo Picasso's La Muse Mathura Style Leonid Afremov's Rain Princess Edvard Munch's Scream Théodore Géricault's Raft of the Medusa Roberto Matta

block-definition.s: get costume features of %'costume' then %'receive features'
read URL %'URL' then %'receive contents' or if error %'receive error' using an access key if needed %'key' in JSON format %'JSON'
block-definition.comment: Reads the contents of 'URL' and then calls 'receive contents' with that text (in HTML). If there was an error 'receive error' is called instead. 'key' needs only be provided if the URL requires as access key.

block-definition.s: Ask Wikipedia about %'search words' $nl then %'process response' with list of matches $nl but if error %'process error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Searches Wikipedia for 'search words' and then passes the list of results to 'process response'.

custom-block.s: read URL %txt then %cmdRing or if error %cmdRing using an access key if needed %txt in JSON format %b

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

custom-block.s: Create custoume from camera %b and pass it to %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Create custoume from camera %'mirrored' and pass it to %'process costume'
block-definition.comment: Creates a costume from the video camera and passes it the 'process costume' blocks.

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' perform %'number of experiments' experiments with each running %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment and after 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available.

block-definition.s: Load %'kind of data' data from URL %'URL' $nl and add to any previous data %'add to previous data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then %'do when data loaded' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads training or validataion data previously saved using the "tensorflow.js" page opened using the "Open support panel ..." block.
Reports a list of 'n' between 1 and 'maximum'. Multiplying and dividing by 1000 produces numbers with 3 decimal places.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'model name' %'n' times $nl then when completed %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. There is a full-featured version of this block.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'model name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl with input size %'input size' then %'do when created'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data. There is another version of this block with more inputs.

custom-block.s: Create a neural network model %txt %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with input size %s %br then %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

block-definition.s: Create a neural network model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Distance Compute Weighted Loss Cosine Distance Hinge Loss Huber Loss Log Loss Mean Squared Error Sigmoid Cross Entropy Softmax Cross Entropy

block-definition.s: Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'
Get predictions from model(s) %'model name(s)' with inputs %'inputs' $nl then %'process predictions' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to make predictions for each value in 'inputs'. Can also average the predictions from a list of models.

block-definition.s: Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Load neural net from URL %'URL' $nl then when loaded %'do when loaded' $nl unless there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads a model previously saved using the interface on the 'tensorflow.js' page which can be opened using the 'Open support panel ...' block.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.

block-definition.s: inform %'message' with title %'title' $nl ok to repeat same message %'ok'
block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it. Can supress duplicate messages.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' (expert version) $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with activation function %'activation function' $nl with dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural network with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. The 'activation function' is applied after the weighted inputs are summed. 'dropout rate' adds some noise to training that helps prevent overfitting to the training data. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error
reluelu hardSigmoid linear relu relu6 selu sigmoid softmax softplus softsign tanh

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Get prediction from model(s) %'model names' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once. 'Model names' can be a list of names or a single name. Categories should only be provided if the prediction is for labelling the input.
Loads any of the 'model names' if they aren't already loaded.

custom-block.s: Load neural net from URL %txt %br then when loaded %cmdRing %br unless there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished' $nl and if output are labels use these %'labels'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to be used by training blocks. Note that if the output are labels of categories then if you are also providing validation data then provide the same list of labels. Note all data whose output is not one of the labels is automatically removed.

block-definition.s: Set TensorFlow support window visualization options $nl graph width: %'width' $nl graph height: %'height' $nl minimum loss: %'minimum loss' $nl maximum loss: %'maximum loss' $nl display graphs: %'display graphs' $nl display layers: %'display layers' $nl display confusion matrices: %'display confusion matrices'
block-definition.comment: This block customises what is seen if the 'Open support panel tensorflow.js" block is run. If 'display graphs' is true then a graph of the loss over each iteration is displayed. You can control its dimensions and the range of values. If 'display layers' is true then statistics about each layer is displayed. If 'display confusion matrices' is true on the output are labels (not numbers) then confusion matrices are displayed.

block-definition.s: Check if %'model name' exists $nl then do %'process answer'

block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with number of samples %'number of samples' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where each experiment should run the same parameters %n times %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 Varying these parameters: %br ...optimization method %b %br ...loss function %b %br ...activation function %b %br ...shuffle data %b %br ...learning rate %b %br ...number of training iterations %b %br ...validation split %b %br ...dropout rate %b %br ...number and size of layers %b %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these scoring weights: %br ...loss weight %n %br ...accuracy weight %n %br ...duration weight %n %br ...size of model weight %n %br ...variance of score weight %n %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these initial settings: %br ...learning rate %n %br ...stop training if no progress for %n cycles %br ...fraction set aside for validation from training data %n %br ...shuffle data after each step %b

custom-block.l: Error while searching for good parameters

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl where each experiment should run the same parameters %'number of samples' times $nl where at first run %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 Varying these parameters: $nl ...optimization method %'vary optimization method' $nl ...loss function %'vary loss function' $nl ...activation function %'vary activation function' $nl ...shuffle data %'vary whether to shuffle data' $nl ...learning rate %'vary learning rate' $nl ...number of training iterations %'vary number of training iterations' $nl ...validation split %'vary validation split' $nl ...dropout rate %'vary dropout rate' $nl ...number and size of layers %'vary number of layers' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these scoring weights: $nl ...loss weight %'loss weight' $nl ...accuracy weight %'accuracy weight' $nl ...duration weight %'duration weight' $nl ...size of model weight %'size weight' $nl ...variance of score weight %'standard deviation weight' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these initial settings: $nl ...learning rate %'learning rate' $nl ...stop training if no progress for %'stop if no progress' cycles $nl ...fraction set aside for validation from training data %'validation fraction' $nl ...shuffle data after each step %'shuffle data'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment. Each experiment will average the results of 'number of samples' runs with the same hyperparameters. After 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available. It scores each experiment by adding the weighted values of the loss, accuracy, time to train, number of parameter, and degree of variability in the outcome scores.

block-definition.s: process best parameters %'best parameters' %'number of replacements' %'number of experiments' %'number of samples' %'initial training cycles' %'when an experiment finishes' %'do with parameters' %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Replace model named %txt with the best model found %br and when finished %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

custom-block.l: Error while replacing model with best model while searching.

custom-block.s: Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: set pen color to r: %'r' g: %'g' b: %'b'
square of distance from features %'features 1' to %'features 2'
block-definition.comment: When comparing distances one can save some time by avoiding many calls to square root. See also the 'distance from features ...' block.
Reports distance to the center of the space. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norm_(mathematics)#Euclidean_norm
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_product
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosine_similarity There is a faster JavaScript version of this.

block-definition.s: Snap! version of closest word to %'target features' except %'exceptions' and report progress %'report progress'
block-definition.comment: See "closest word to ..." that is much much faster.

custom-block.s: all words in language %txt with features

list.l: is the best match so far after looking at

custom-block.s: square of distance from features %l to %l

block-definition.comment: Euclidean distance between features using Snap! hyperblocks.
Reports the average value of corresponding items in the two lists.

block-definition.s: mean distance of %'word' to %'words' $nl using %'distance measure' in language %'language'
block-definition.comment: Reports the average distance from 'word' to each of the 'words'.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: Euclidean distance between %l and %l using JavaScript

block-definition.comment: Reports the average of each element in the list.

block-definition.s: map %'function' across each item in %'data lists'
block-definition.comment: Apples function to corresponding items in the 'data lists'.

block-definition.s: Euclidean distance between %'point 1' and %'point 2' using JavaScript
block-definition.comment: Reports the distance between the points. Works with any dimensions from 1 to what fits in memory. To see how this can be implemented in a slower way in Snap! open the 'distance from features ... to ...' block
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosine_similarity There is a pure Snap! version of this.

Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.

block-definition.s: all words in language %'language' with features
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words that have a list of features accessible via the "features of" reporter block. Data obtained from https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.s: closest word to %'features' $nl in language %'language' $nl not including %'exceptions' $nl and do as words are found %'when word found' $nl with distance measure %'distance measure'
block-definition.comment: Reports the word that is closest to the features. Uses a distance measure which can be either Eucliean Distance or Cosine similarity. You can choose from among 15 languages or leave it blank for the default language. Optionally one can "watch" it search by adding blocks to the "when word found" slot. The block is passed the best word so far, its distance, and the number of words considered so far.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.comment: Reports a location of a word embedding use t-SNE. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-distributed_stochastic_neighbor_embedding

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block.comment: Convert from 0 to 1 coordinates to Snap! coordinations.

block-definition.s: set pen color to h: %'h' s: %'s' v: %'v'

block.l: var col = new Color(); col.set_hsv(h, s, v); this.setColor(col);

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.s: display word %'word' in language %'language' with size %'size' and zoom by %'zoom'
block-definition.comment: Displays the word near similar words.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

block.comment: Attempt to center the word. 12/2 would be correct if every character was full width.

custom-block.s: set pen color to h: %n s: %n v: %n

block.comment: Display the word centered at the location.

custom-block.s: set pen color to h: %n s: %n v: %n

block-definition.s: closest word to %'features' $nl in language %'language' $nl not including %'exceptions'
block-definition.comment: Reports the word that is closest to the features. You can choose from among 15 languages or leave it blank for the default language. There is a full-featured version of this block as well.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 300 numbers that "describes" the word. You can choose among 15 languages or leave it blank and use the default language. To learn about these numbers see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Word_embedding The new name for this block is "features of word ..."

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

block-definition.s: closest words to %'features' in language %'language' $nl and include distances %'include distances'
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words sorted by closeness to 'features'. Optionally can report pairs of words and distances. Distances are measured using cosine similarity.

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

block-definition.s: Answer %'question' from %'passage' $nl process answers with %'answers receiver' $nl and if there is error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: Uses 'passage' to answer 'question'. The 'answer question' reporter is easier to use and relies upon this block.

scripts.comment: This uses BERT to answer questions. See https://blog.tensorflow.org/2020/03/exploring-helpful-uses-for-bert-in-your-browser-tensorflow-js.html

block-definition.comment: Reports the top answer to the 'question' using the 'passage'.

custom-block.s: Get up to 5 answers to question %txt from passage %txt

block-definition.s: Get up to 5 answers to question %'question' from passage %'passage'
block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 5 elements where each element is a list of an answer to the 'question' and its score of how good an answer it is. The highest scoring answer is first.

custom-block.s: Answer %txt from %txt %br process answers with %cmdRing %br and if there is error %cmdRing

block.comment: Only report the answers and scores. Not the position of the 'passage' that the answer is based upon.

block-definition.s: Wikipedia summary of covid-19 from 6 April 2020

block.l: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The outbreak was first noted in Wuhan, Hubei province, China, in December 2019. The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the outbreak to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020 and recognized it as a pandemic on 11 March 2020. As of 6 April 2020, more than 1,270,000 cases of COVID-19 have been reported in over 200 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 69,400 deaths. More than 260,000 people have recovered. The virus is mainly spread during close contact, and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking. These small droplets may also be produced during breathing, but rapidly fall to the ground or surfaces and are not generally spread through the air over large distances. People may also catch COVID-19 by touching a contaminated surface and then their face. The virus can survive on surfaces for up to 72 hours. It is most contagious during the first 3 days after symptom onset, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease. The time between exposure and symptom onset is typically around five days, but may range from 2 to 14 days. Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome. There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment. Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy. Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected. Efforts to prevent the virus spread include travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, event postponements and cancellations, and facility closures. These include national or regional quarantines throughout the world (starting with the quarantine of Hubei), curfew measures in mainland China, various border closures or incoming passenger restrictions, screening at airports and train stations, and outgoing passenger travel bans. The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, and cultural events, and widespread fears of supply shortages resulting in panic buying. Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in more than 160 countries, affecting approximately 97 percent of the world's student population. Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from hotspots.

block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.comment: A concise shortcut to the 'features of ...' block. It uses English.
A concise shortcut to the 'closest word to ...' block. Uses English and excludes no words.

custom-block.s: closest word to %l %br in language %txt %br not including %l

block-definition.comment: Allows reading global settings programmatically. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.

input.options: Project notes Project name User Presentation mode Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Hyper blocks support Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); switch (which) { case 'Project notes': return ide.projectNotes; case 'Project name': return ide.projectName; case 'User': return ide.cloud.username; case 'Presentation mode': return ide.isAppMode; case 'Language': return SnapTranslator.language; case 'Zoom blocks': return SyntaxElementMorph.prototype.scale; case 'Stage size': return new List([StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.x, StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.y]); case 'Stage scale': return stage.scale; case 'Retina display support': return isRetinaEnabled(); case 'Long form input dialog': return InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded; case 'Plain prototype labels': return BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel; case 'Input sliders': return MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput; case 'Execute on slider change': return ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit; case 'Clicking sound': return !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound; case 'Turbo mode': return stage.isFastTracked; case 'Flat design': return MorphicPreferences.isFlat; case 'Keyboard editing': return !!this.scripts.focus; case 'Visible stepping': return Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping; case 'Thread safe scripts': return stage.isThreadSafe; case 'Prefer smooth animations': return StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0; case 'Flat line ends': return SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds; case 'Codification support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping; case 'Inheritance support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance; case 'Hyper blocks support': return Process.prototype.enableHyperOps; default: return which; case 'Visible palette': return ide.currentCategory; }

block-definition.comment: Allows changing global settings programmatically. This block is for Boolean (checkbox) settings; use SET VALUE for numeric or text values. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera o valor da configuração _ para _

input.options: Presentation mode Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Hyper blocks support

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph), thisObj = this; if (tf != !!tf) return; try{ ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Presentation mode': if (tf != ide.isAppMode) ide.toggleAppMode(); break; case 'Retina display support': if (tf != isRetinaEnabled()) ide.toggleRetina(); break; case 'Long form input dialog': if (tf != InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded) ide.toggleLongFormInputDialog(); break; case 'Plain prototype labels': if (tf != BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel) ide.togglePlainPrototypeLabels(); break; case 'Input sliders': MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput = tf; break; case 'Execute on slider change': ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit = tf; break; case 'Clicking sound': if (tf != !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound) BlockMorph.prototype.toggleSnapSound(); break; case 'Turbo mode': if (tf != stage.isFastTracked) ide.toggleFastTracking(); break; case 'Flat design': if (tf == MorphicPreferences.isFlat) break; if (tf) ide.flatDesign(); else ide.defaultDesign(); break; case 'Keyboard editing': if (thisObj.scripts.focus && !tf) { thisObj.scripts.focus.stopEditing(); } else if (tf && !thisObj.scripts.focus) { thisObj.scripts.toggleKeyboardEntry(); }; break; case 'Visible stepping': if (tf != Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping) ide.toggleSingleStepping(); break; case 'Thread safe scripts': stage.isThreadSafe = tf; break; case 'Prefer smooth animations': if (tf != (StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0)) ide.toggleVariableFrameRate(); break; case 'Flat line ends': SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds = tf; break; case 'Codification support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping) { StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; case 'Inheritance support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance) { StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; case 'Hyper blocks support': Process.prototype.enableHyperOps = tf; break; }; } finally { ide.savingPreferences = false; };

block-definition.comment: Allows changing global settings programmatically. This block is for numeric or text settings; use SET FLAG for Boolean (checkbox) values. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera o valor da configuração _ para _

input.options: Project notes Project name Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); try { ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Project notes': ide.projectNotes = value; break; case 'Project name': ide.setProjectName(value); break; case 'Language': ide.setLanguage(value); break; case 'Zoom blocks': if (!isNaN(value)) ide.setBlocksScale(Math.min(value, 12)); break; case 'Stage size': if ((value instanceof List) && value.length()==2 && !isNaN(value.at(1)) && !isNaN(value.at(2))) ide.setStageExtent(new Point(value.at(1), value.at(2))); break; case 'Stage scale': ide.toggleStageSize(value != 1, Math.max(0.1, value)); break; case 'Visible palette': ide.currentCategory = value.toLowerCase(); ide.categories.children.forEach(function (each) { each.refresh(); }); ide.refreshPalette(true); break; }; } finally {ide.savingPreferences = true; };
